CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Administrative proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time)
JUDGES: Egidijus Kūris;Vincent A. De Gaetano;Gabriele Kucsko-Stadlmayer
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant applied for rent allowance ( GPE ) under LAW ( PERSON ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Magistrat der PERSON ) dismissed the applicant ’s request , holding that the applicant was not eligible for rent allowance as his income exceeded the statutory limit ( GPE ) .
CARDINAL . The applicant appealed and complained that ORG had failed to take into account his maintenance obligations towards his CARDINAL sons .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( ORG PERSON ) dismissed the appeal , holding that maintenance obligations were , according to ORG case - law , not to be considered as income - reducing , as long as no enforcement proceedings were instituted against the applicant ’s income .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the applicant ’s request for legal aid in order to file a complaint against ORG decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a complaint with ORG , claiming in essence that ORG had wrongly interpreted ORG case - law as regards the nonconsideration of the applicant ’s maintenance obligations .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG declined to deal with the applicant ’s complaint , holding that it did not raise any questions of constitutional law and transferred the case to ORG .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant submitted his amended complaint to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s complaint as unfounded . Referring to its case - law , it held that the applicant had failed to argue that he was in a state of emergency due to enforcement proceedings being conducted in connection to his maintenance obligations . It was therefore not unlawful that ORG had refrained from taking into account the applicant ’s maintenance payments when assessing his eligibility for rent allowance .
CARDINAL . NORP This decision was served on the applicant ’s counsel on DATE .
